comments.body: Just to cover most options wouldn't `if not dns_name` be better?

I agree that in this case, `if not dns_name` would probably work. I can't think of a case where the Cobbler API will return any other [Python Falsey values](https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#truth-value-testing) for the value of the DNS name.

I tend to prefer being explicit about my comparisons. It avoids bugs caused by unexpected inputs. 

If there is a coding standard or some "Pythonic" rule I'm breaking, I'd be happy to change it.
nah, just inherit lazyness ... less code means less typing and less reading
